entry.title: One Paper Accepted to ICDM 2022
entry.content: Our paper SparRL: Graph Sparsification via Deep Reinforcement Learning has been accepted to IEEE ICDM, a top-tier data mining conference. Congratulations to all the authors!

entry.title: Distinguished Colloquium by Prof. Siris
entry.content: Christos and Weizi co-hosted Prof. Siris from the Athens University of Economics and Business (AUEB), who gave a talk titled “New results on Decentralized Identifiers and their application to the Internet of Things and Content Delivery” for the distinguished colloquium series of the CS department at UofM.

entry.title: Supriya Sarker Joins STARS
entry.content: Supriya is from central Bangladesh. She has worked on predictive analysis for intelligent transportation systems to ensure safe driving behaviors. Her research interests also include machine learning (reinforcement learning), data science, autonomous vehicles, and explainable AI. If you would like to know more about her projects, please find it here. Besides studying, She loves to read story books and watch movies.

entry.title: Abhinay Bhatla Joins STARS
entry.content: Abhi is a high school Senior at Collierville High School and is a Tennessee native who was born and raised in Memphis. He enjoys playing recreational sports with his friends such as basketball and tennis and also enjoys playing video games. He looks to gain research experience and further his interest in programming by helping with STARS.

entry.title: One Paper Accepted to IROS 2022
entry.content: Our paper Inverse Reinforcement Learning with Hybrid-weight Trust-region Optimization and Curriculum Learning for Autonomous Maneuvering has been accepted to IEEE/RSJ IROS, a top-tier robotics conference. Congratulations to all the authors!

entry.title: One Paper Accepted to ITSC 2022
entry.content: Our paper Learning to Control DC Motor for Micromobility in Real Time with Reinforcement Learning has been accepted to ITSC, the flagship conference of IEEE ITSS. Congratulations to all the authors!

entry.title: Shahzeb Kazmi Joins STARS
entry.content: Shahzeb, nicknamed Sunny, is currently a Senior Computer Science and Mathematics student, concentrating in Artificial Intelligence. He was born in Memphis, Tennessee, but often visits Pakistan to connect with family. In his free time, Shahzeb likes to edit videos and play board games with his friends.

entry.title: Distinguished Colloquium by Prof. Stone
entry.content: At the invitation of Weizi, Prof. Stone from the University of Texas at Austin gave a talk titled “Outracing Champion Gran Turismo Drivers with Deep Reinforcement Learning” for the distinguished colloquium series of the CS department at UofM.

entry.title: Distinguished Colloquium by Prof. Cummings
entry.content: At the invitation of Weizi, Prof. Cummings from the Duke University gave a talk titled “The Interaction of Autonomy & Training for First-Person Drone Flights” for the distinguished colloquium series of the CS department at UofM.

entry.title: Academic Hardware Grant from NVIDIA
entry.content: Our project “Towards Effective and Efficient City-scale Traffic Reconstruction” has received the academic hardware grant by NVIDIA. Thanks, NVIDIA!

entry.title: Weizi Li Invited to Programme Committee of ICLR Workshop
entry.content: Weizi is invited to serve in the programme committee of the ICLR Workshop “Generalizable Policy Learning in the Physical World.”

entry.title: Project Awarded by National Science Foundation
entry.content: We have been awarded a $175K grant from the National Science Foundation for our project “CRII: III: Towards Effective and Efficient City-scale Traffic Reconstruction.” More information can be found at the NSF award abstract site.

entry.title: Artificial Intelligence Course
entry.content: Weizi is offering the newly designed course, COMP 4720 “Intro to Artificial Intelligence” in Spring 2022.

entry.title: Isaac Nkrumah Joins STARS
entry.content: Isaac received his B.S. in Computer Science at Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology. He enjoys swimming and playing soccer.

entry.title: Invited Talk at HKU
entry.content: Weizi is invited to give a talk at the Department of Computer Science at the University of Hong Kong in Fall 2021.

entry.title: Invitation from Oak Ridge National Laboratory
entry.content: Weizi is invited to attend the workshop “Paving the Road to Future Automotive Research Datasets: Challenges and Opportunities” hosted by the Oak Ridge National Laboratory.

entry.title: One Paper Accepted to NeurlPS 2021
entry.content: Our paper Gradient-Free Adversarial Training Against Image Corruption for Learning-based Steering has been accepted to NeurlPS, a top-tier machine learning conference. Congratulations to all the authors!

entry.title: STARS at ITSC 2021
entry.content: Bibek and Weizi attended ITSC 2021 held in Indianapolis, IN, USA.

entry.title: One Paper Accepted to TRB 2021
entry.content: Our paper Data-driven Graph Filter based Graph Convolutional Neural Network Approach for Network-Level Multi-Step Traffic Prediction has been accepted to TRB, the largest transportation conference. Congratulations to all the authors!

entry.title: One Paper Accepted to ITSC 2021
entry.content: Our paper Black-box Adversarial Attacks on Network-wide Multi-step Traffic State Prediction Models has been accepted to ITSC, the flagship conference of IEEE ITSS. Congratulations to all the authors!

entry.title: Shivam Aarya Joins STARS
entry.content: Shivam is a high school Junior at White Station High School. He is a visiting student at Stanford University in Summer 2022.

entry.title: Michael Villarreal Joins STARS
entry.content: Michael received his B.S. in Computer Science at the University of Memphis. He is a Tennessee native from Jackson, TN (about an hour east of Memphis). He enjoys rock climbing and frequently takes outdoor climbing trips to Jamestown, AR and Chattanooga, TN. He also used to be a runner averaging over 1500 miles/year for several years. He owns a cat and a hedgehog named Celeste and Sable, respectively (both names come from Animal Crossing).

entry.title: One Paper Accepted by Scientific Reports
entry.content: Our paper Assessing inequality, irregularity, and severity regarding road traffic safety during COVID-19 has been accepted by Scientific Reports. Congratulations to all the authors!

entry.title: One Paper Accepted by IEEE ITSM
entry.content: Our paper Vehicle Trajectory Prediction Using LSTMs with Spatial-Temporal Attention Mechanisms has been accepted by IEEE ITSM, a leading journal of Intelligent Transportation Systems. Congratulations to all the authors!

entry.title: Reinforcement Learning Course
entry.content: Weizi is offering the newly designed course, COMP 7901 “Reinforcement Learning” in Spring 2021.

entry.title: Project Through FedEx Institute of Technology
entry.content: The explorative project “Trailer Loading Optimization” is funded by FedEx Institute of Technology.

entry.title: Deep Learning Course
entry.content: Weizi is offering the newly designed course, COMP 4741 “Neurocomputing”, which focuses on Deep Learning in Fall 2020.

entry.title: Bibek Poudel Joins STARS
entry.content: Bibek is from Parbat, Nepal, around the foothills of the 7th highest mountain in the world—Dhaulagiri. He received his B.E. in Electronics and Communications from Kathmandu Engineering College, Tribhuvan University. He is a jack of many trades including swimming and playing guitar.
